text: The original version of I Can See Your Voice (abbreviated ICSYV and also stylized as I Can See Your Voice — Mystery music game show) () is a television mystery music game show that broadcasts originally on Mnet and is simulcast on tvN in South Korea. == Gameplay == ===Format=== Presented with a group of six "mystery singers", a guest artist must attempt to eliminate bad singers from the group without ever hearing them sing, assisted by clues and "celebrity panelists" over the course of three rounds. The guest artist must eliminate one to two mystery singers at the end of each round and then proceeding to perform on the "stage of truth". At the end, the winning mystery singer is revealed as good or bad — by means of a duet with one of the guest artists. The original version has two gameplay formats: ;Original format Under the original format, the guest artist(s) could eliminate one or two mystery singers in each round, and the last mystery singer(s) standing will do perform a duet. ;Star wars format (season 1, final episode only) Under the star wars format, ten former mystery singers were separated into two teams. For each round, a mystery singer is chosen for a "showdown". Afterwards, the voting is done through audience majority, and the votes are accumulated for the winning team. ;Rewards The winning good singer is awarded on the following conditions: *If it is a good singer, he or she gets a digital single release. In the fifth season's premiere, he or she gets a customized microphone. *If it is a bad singer, he or she gets a cash prize worth ₩5,000,000 ($4,500). ===Rounds=== There were six individuals or groups of mystery singers standing on the platform with its aliases to keep their identities concealed until the stage of truth performance. ;Singer's visual *The guest artist(s) is given some time to observe and examine each mystery singer based on their appearance. After this, a muted video of each mysyery singer that reveals only 0.3 seconds of their singing voice is played as an additional hint.Used in season 1. Used in season 2.Used in season 3. *Each mystery singer is given two identities – as a good singer and as a bad singer. Only one of them is their real identity.Used in season 4.Used in season 5. Used in season 6. Used in season 7. ;Singer's speech *Each mystery singer introduces using their own voice. ;Singer's lip-sync *Each mystery singer performs a lip-sync of a song. Good singers lip-sync to their own voice, while bad singers lip-sync to other's voices. *A mystery singer and a substitute lip-sync to the song together. Only one of them is the owner of the voice. *The mystery singer lip-syncs to the good singer's voice, then the bad singer's voice comes in the middle of the performance. ;Singer's verdict *Identify the good and bad singers within 100 seconds based on its true statement. *The guest artist(s) must have then 100 seconds to interrogate the remaining mystery singers before making the final decision. ;Singer's evidence *A proof of each mystery singer's singing ability (i.e. photo, video, certificates, etc.) is shown on the screen. Good singers have their own evidences while bad singers had their evidences fabricated. *Three randomly selected panelists must hear the mystery singer's singing voice using a headphone for 30 seconds. Afterwards, he or she must defend the mystery singer and convince the guest artist(s) to choose him/her as the final mystery singer. *The hosts of the show have randomly assigned clues about the mystery singer.
